toc_entry.title: The Lost Tribe
toc_entry.description: They were the classic Texas Indians—fierce, majestic, and free. Today’s Comanches find their lives defined by legends and bitter truths.

toc_entry.title: The Wooing Of Chairman Wang
toc_entry.description: The decision by a Chinese plastics company to build a billion-dollar plant in Texas proves that economic development works—but it comes at a high price.

toc_entry.title: Art For HEArt's Sake
toc_entry.description: A great big valentine from 95 artists to a San antonio hospital’s transplant program.

toc_entry.title: “I’m a Nazi Until Death”
toc_entry.description: Out of work, at loggerheads with their parents, and under constant police surveillance since they turned to an alien ideology, Dallas’ radical skinheads remain defiant.

toc_entry.title: A Dirty, Rotten Mess
toc_entry.description: Every day each of us contributes five pounds to the growing mountain of garbage. Now the mountain looks like a volcano that’s threatening to erupt.

toc_entry.title: Chip Ahoy
toc_entry.description: A new gambling-cruise-ship enterprise out of Port Isabel makes it possible to spend an evening in a casino while going nowhere in the Gulf.

toc_entry.title: Jailhouse Hock
toc_entry.subtitle: Politics
toc_entry.description: Bill Clements’ ambitious—and expensive—prison-expansion plan is only a tiny first step toward escaping the overcrowding problem.

toc_entry.title: Spot Market
toc_entry.subtitle: Environment
toc_entry.description: Ranchers hate bobcats. Trappers love their pelts. Both parties have found that there’s more than one reason to skin a cat.

toc_entry.title: Blithe Spirit
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: It took a bit of coaxing, but when R. T. Williams finally sat down at the piano again, the Grey Ghost came back to life.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Never giving in; making it big; reclaiming a neighborhood.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Looking forward to Jerry Jeff Walker’s second Luckenbach, looking into a new way to settle feuds, and looking back over the career of Texas’ most prolific unknown author.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: A competency test for colleges; gauging the governor’s race; hard times at Hermann Hospital; what on earth was George Bush thinking about?.
